question: Which city is the headquarters of the "Southern African Development Community"?
explanation: The Southern African Development Community is an intergovernmental organization established in 1992, headquartered in the capital city of Botswana, Gaborone, to further socio-economic cooperation and integration as well as political and security cooperation among sixteen Southern African countries such as Angola, Botswana, Comoros, Democratic Republic of Congo, Eswatini, Lesotho, Madagascar, Malawi, Mauritius, Mozambique, Namibia, Seychelles, South Africa, Tanzania, Zambia, and Zimbabwe
